p: Certain US states, however, have passed legislation that may impact the use of cannabis derived products in veterinary patients. For instance, the US state of Vermont has enacted legislation defining hemp to include products intended for animals. Additionally, US state of Nevada has enacted legislation regarding the manufacturing and marketing of hemp-derived products for animals and in US California state the State Board of Veterinary Medicine has established guidelines for the veterinary discussions of such products [ 72, 73, 74]. Most recently, in US state Michigan, legislation was approved allowing veterinarians to consult with animal owners on the use of marijuana or industrial hemp for their animals [ 75].
